fields.title: Shawsank Redemption
fields.review: The Shawshank Redemption has great performances, extremely well written script and story all leading to a deeply emotional climax

fields.title: The Dark Knight
fields.review: A dark, gritty, and realistic look on how superheroes would act and how they can remain unidentified

fields.title: The Godfather
fields.review: It is a gangster film without any of the pity and hatred we might feel towards such aliens in our midst, because it recognises that in all of us there is the ignition towards power and criminality.

fields.title: Coco
fields.review: Un poco loco is my favourite song of all time

fields.title: Baby Driver
fields.review: It's thrilling filmmaking, a total blast, and rarely misses a beat

fields.title: Pokemon: Mewtwo Strikes Back
fields.review: The plot was great. Designs was excellent as well. I remember watching the original movie back when I was a kid.

fields.title: se7en
fields.review: Seven is not really a very deep or profound film, but it provides the convincing illusion of one

fields.title: Inception
fields.review: It is a film about movies and dreams and reality, and what sort of life it is best to find when you leave the cinema and return to whatever you left to enter.

fields.title: The Prestige
fields.review: The Prestige is a very engaging movie with many story lines to follow. When it's finally exposed it kind of ruins it.

fields.title: Interstellar
fields.review: Interstellar is a movie like no other. Unlike many apocalyptic sci-fi films that feature advanced technology as the source of our destruction (ala The Terminator movies), it instead asserts that technology will save us.
